intro: Cephaelis singapurensis, commonly known as the Singapore cephaleis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
